Award.AwardTitle: Fluid Dynamics of Living Systems: A Workshop on Future Directions in Biological Fluid Dynamics

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
Proposal Number: 1439983

This is a project to partially cover travel and organizing expenses related to the workshop entitled "Workshop on Emerging Directions in Biological Fluid Dynamics" that will be held in Arlington, Virginia, on September 15 and 16, 2014.

The aim of this workshop is to bring together engineers and scientists, who do not have such a chance in other professional meetings, to define core areas of interest in biological fluid dynamics that are of critical technological and societal importance. The meeting will be attended by both prominent and young scientists in fluid dynamics from around the Nation, who will be discussing future directions of research and research challenges in these research areas. The meeting will focus on addressing challenges that need to be overcome in order to advance the field for the next five to ten years.

About 100 attendees are expected to attend, including engineers and mathematicians involved in all aspects of theoretical, computational, and experimental biological fluid dynamics and scientists from adjacent fields including comparative and integrative biology, oceanography, marine science, medicine, molecular and cellular physics, and epidemiology. The American Institute of Physics Publishing (AIP) will publish proceedings from the conference in an open-access format.

Institution.Name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: VIRGINIA POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE AND STATE UNIVERSITY

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project consisted of holding a meeting entitled, "Fluid Dynamics of Living Systems: A Workshop on Future Directions in Biological Fluid Dynamics." The meeting was held on September 15 and 16, 2014 in Arlington, Virginia at the Westin Arlington Gateway. This meeting brought a variety of prominent and young researchers in biological fluid dynamics and in biology, medicine, physics, and oceanography, and other fields that intersect with fluids. The meeting served as a venue for participants to learn about and discuss emerging directions in biological fluid dynamics that will have potentially profound impact in many areas of engineering, science, technology, and medicine, with a focus on identifying and defining a set of grand challenge problems.

The following topics were identified as critical areas of interdisciplinary research in biological fluid dynamics: (1) the fluid dynamics of coastal benthic ecosystems, (2) multiscale hemodynamics modeling, (3) blood occlusions in the microcirculation, (4) the fluid dynamics of disease transmission, and (5) the micromechanics of respiratory flows.

Additionally, A USNC/TAM Report on Recent Trends in Mechanics is forthcoming in 2016 that summarizies findings from the meeting about fruitful new directions in biological fluid mechanics. This report should be a useful information resource for researchers who were not able to attend the meeting.


Last Modified: 02/21/2016
Modified by: Anne Staples
